Amend permit #2017-2009. The temporary retaining wall ( north wall ) will be reinforced with a soil nail type system, in accordance with a stamped engineered planned installation and mass code. The multiple soil nail wall will allow more room behind the forms and safer access to the water management system that will be installed around the footing . Our main reason for this application is to make a larger work area during the concrete wall build, once the wall is in place the backfilled foundation can take over. Our meeting with DPW has left us with a clear opportunity to install this application without an easement because of the location ( below utilities ) and the nature of the soil nail wall ( temporary ). If for some reason DPW needed to dig to or below our soil nailers in the future , it would have no affect on the structure as the nails would be redundant.

To Amend Permit ALT45184 to alter the fire sprinkler coverage adjacent to and above elevator equipment in compliance with 780 CMR 903.2 Exception 4. The purpose is to reduce the likelihood of the fire sprinklers discharging water onto the elevator equipment. The amendment will maintain coverage for the remainder of the Atrium floor area, the elevator zone in which no sprinklers are allowed (Sketches C and D, and annotated drawings A2.4 and A2.5). Attached sketches SKFP-003 and SKFP-004 show the proposed fire sprinkler layouts at the Atrium Ground Floor and the Atrium skylight in conformance with the Elevator Code and 780 CMR 903.2 Exception 4).;; We request that ISD and the Boston Fire Department approve this Amendment to the Building Permit to omit fire sprinklers in the designated elevator area and modify other sprinklers as shown in the attached diagrams.

Amend Permit ALT113727 to Eliminate intumescent varnish in first floor reception, first floor lobby, second floor balcony as well as window casings on first and second floor. The premise is listed on the National Register of Historic Places. The Massachusetts Historical Commission, the Boston Landmarks Commission and the Boston Preservation Alliance seek to have the lobby area remain substantially in its present condition. Applicant proposes a compliance alternative to the intumescent varnish, which is detailed in the attached memorandum, which in substance proposes the removal of certain portions of the existing wood paneling in combination with sprinklering of the affected areas. Substitute unrated framing and glass at glazed wall areas between new Main Stair and Café/Lobby, new Main Stair and gymnasium, new main stair and 2nd floor Wellness. Install additional sprinkler heads as shown. Cost reflects on ALT113727 ;Per Plan

E -Plan The Elevator Lobby was designed with a minimum dimension of 8 feet. However, an additional wood veneer will be added to the walls, creating a minimum dimension of 7’9”. This dimension and veneer addition can be seen in the diagram attached to the bottom of the letter in the electronic plans attachment. According to Section 403.6.1 of 780 CMR 8th Edition, buildings more than 70 feet in height above grade plane must provide a minimum of one fire service access elevator in accordance with Section 3007. Section 3007.4.4 states that the elevator lobby is permitted a minimum dimension of 8 feet. 32 Derne Street is 90 feet in height and therefore must comply with these requirements. The 9th Edition 780 CMR is anticipated to be adopted within the next few months. According to the 9th Edition, and the 2015 IBC, a fire service access elevator is not required unless the building is more than 120 feet in height. The Fifth Floor of 32 Derne Street is new construction and could therefore fall under the 9th Edition. Under the 9th Edition, a fire service access elevator is not required and therefore, the minimum dimension of 7’9” would be permitted. We are requesting to follow the 9th edition for the construction of the Fifth Floor of 32 Derne Street, rather than the 8th edition, as the 9th will soon be adopted.

This amendment to existing ERT#654534 encompasses the addition of open roof decks at the perimeter of the 10th floor roof- existing roof level- and the associated stairwells from each of the 10-9th floor penthouse residential units. This amendment includes a complete perimeter glass guardrail as well as screen partitions between each of the 10 individual roof decks. Access corridors are provided to the central building stairwells as a second means if egress. The decks have a raised wood floor on top of the existing rubber roof as well as small islands with exterior kitchenettes. The mixed use building remains: Apartments (group R-2, residential 106 units), restaurant (Future) (group A-2, assembly), amenity spaces (group A-3,assembly): dry goods retail (Future) (group M, mercantile).
